title: Modal Verbs - Can, Could, Be able to

questions.question: Which modal verb is used to express ability in the present?
choices: Can
Could
May
Might

questions.question: What is the past form of 'can'?
choices: Could
Was able to
Can't
Couldn't

questions.question: Which sentence expresses a past ability correctly?
choices: I can swim when I was young.
I could to swim when I was young.
I was able to swim across the lake yesterday.
I am able to swim when I was young.
questions.answer: I was able to swim across the lake yesterday.

questions.question: What is the main difference between 'can' and 'be able to'?
choices: 'Be able to' can be used in all tenses, while 'can' is limited to present and past
'Can' is more formal than 'be able to'
'Be able to' is only used for physical abilities
There is no difference; they are always interchangeable
questions.answer: 'Be able to' can be used in all tenses, while 'can' is limited to present and past

questions.question: Which sentence uses 'could' correctly to express a polite request?
choices: Could you pass me the salt, please?
Can you to pass me the salt, please?
Are you able pass me the salt, please?
Would you can pass me the salt, please?
questions.answer: Could you pass me the salt, please?
